description: An examination of European social, economic, political and cultural development from 1500 to the present, with attention to Europe's impact on the rest of the world.
name: EUROPE: 1500-PRESENT

values.comments: This course is an examination of European social, economic, political and cultural development from 1500 to the present, with attention to Europe's impact on the rest of the world.   Students felt that this course tried to cover too much material in too short of a time frame. As one student wrote, “It was simply too much of a time frame to learn the amount of material we should have grasped”. There was also not much discussion or student participation in the class.  Professor Schauer received high marks from students. He “was extremely helpful” and “approachable” and was able to convey a vast amount of material in a “coherent” way.   This course fulfills the History and Tradition Sector
